creditline: Gift of Dr. Michael and Jananne Nelson
description: plate with downward-turning rim on a short foot; 2 fish, a shell, a shrimp and an octopus on top, with wave decoration around edge
text: This plate is typical of painted ceramics from Apulia, a region of southern Italy, between about 430-300 BCE. During this period many Greek potters and painters immigrated to the region, so the forms and motifs were heavily influenced by Greek styles. The recessed well in the center was meant for fish sauce.
title: Apulian Red Figure Fish Plate
